solution: Define average number of newborn children per adult crow in South Zoo as o; so o = 3. Define average number of newborn children per adult blue jay in South Zoo as d; so d = o = 3. Define average number of newborn children per adult eagle in South Zoo as n; l = d = 3; so n = 2 * l = 2 * 3 = 6. Define adult blue jay in South Zoo as i; W = n = 6; so i = 4 + W = 4 + 6 = 10. Define adult eagle in South Zoo as R; so R = 4. Define adult parrot in South Zoo as j; H = i = 10; so j = 4 * H = 4 * 10 = 40. Define adult crow in South Zoo as I; so I = 3. Define total number of adult animals in South Zoo as Z; t = R + I = 4 + 3 = 7; O = t + j = 7 + 40 = 47; so Z = O + i = 47 + 10 = 57. Define average number of newborn children per adult parrot in South Zoo as y; u = Z + d = 57 + 3 = 60; so y = u + j = 60 + 40 = 100. Answer: 100.

solution: Define adult crow in Beverly Forest as N; so N = 4. Define average number of newborn children per adult crow in Oakridge Riverside as v; so v = N = 4. Define adult blue jay in Beverly Forest as S; A = v + N = 4 + 4 = 8; so S = 1 + A = 1 + 8 = 9. Define average number of newborn children per adult blue jay in Beverly Forest as e; c = S + v = 9 + 4 = 13; so e = c + N = 13 + 4 = 17. Define adult blue jay in Maple Creek as f; so f = 1. Define average number of newborn children per adult blue jay in Maple Creek as K; so K = e + v = 17 + 4 = 21. Define total number of newborn animal children in Maple Creek as p; so p = f * K = 1 * 21 = 21. Define average number of newborn children per adult crow in Beverly Forest as j; V = p + f = 21 + 1 = 22; Z = V + S = 22 + 9 = 31; so j = 4 + Z = 4 + 31 = 35. Answer: 35.

question: What is the total number of teachers from all schools in Brightford?
solution: Define average number of teachers per regional medical school in Westhaven City as t; so t = 3. Define average number of teachers per public highschool in Westhaven City as D; d = t = 3; so D = 3 + d = 3 + 3 = 6. Define regional medical school in Westhaven City as a; so a = t = 3. Define public highschool in Westhaven City as w; so w = t = 3. Define total number of teachers from all schools in Westhaven City as Z; i = a * t = 3 * 3 = 9; I = w * D = 3 * 6 = 18; Z = i + I = 9 + 18 = 27. Define average number of teachers per elementary school in Hawkesbury as W; so W = Z = 27. Define elementary school in Hawkesbury as A; so A = W + a = 27 + 3 = 30. Define total number of schools in Hawkesbury as h; so h = A = 30. Define average number of teachers per culinarian school in Brightford as l; so l = h = 30. Define culinarian school in Brightford as k; so k = l = 30. Define total number of teachers from all schools in Brightford as Q; so Q = k * l = 30 * 30 = 900. Answer: 900.

solution: The question is difficult, so we use equations to solve it. Define average number of newborn children per adult blue jay in Maple Creek as c; so c = 3. Define adult parrot in Pine Ridge as y; so y = c = 3. Define average number of newborn children per adult parrot in Beverly Forest as F; so F = y = 3. Define adult parrot in Beverly Forest as N; q = n = 4; so N = 3 * q = (3) * (4) = 12. Define adult blue jay in Beverly Forest as J; so J = 4. Define average number of newborn children per adult owl in Beverly Forest as x; we don't know its value yet but will find it out later. Define adult owl in Beverly Forest as k; v = J = 4; so k = 4 * v = (4) * (4) = 16. Define total number of newborn animal children in Beverly Forest as f; o = k * x = (16) * (x) = 16*x; w = J * n = (4) * (4) = 16; h = N * F = (12) * (3) = 36; l = o + w = 16*x + 16 = 16*x + 16; f = l + h = 16*x + 16 + 36 = 16*x + 52. We know f = 116, so we have 16*x + 52 = 116 and we solve it through the following steps: Simplifying the equation: 16*x + 52 = 116. Move all terms to one side: 16*x - 64 = 0. Isolate the term with x: 16*x = 64. Divide both sides by 16: x = 64 / 16. Solution: x = 4. Answer: 4.

Define average number of teachers per culinarian school in Shoreline City as j; so j = J + z = 16 + 4 = 20. Define average number of teachers per elementary school in Shoreline City as d; so d = 4.
